issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Unable to set object storage provider: 'Cannot modify objectstorage.providerclient new value is not a valid value'

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When trying to set the object storage provider property the CLC returns the following result:

{noformat}
[10.111.5.2] out:     ---- Begin output of source /root/eucarc && http_proxy="" //usr/sbin/euca-modify-property -p objectstorage.providerclient=walrus ----
[10.111.5.2] out:     STDOUT: Error(ModifyPropertyValueType): Cannot modify objectstorage.providerclient.providerclient new value is not a valid value.  Legal values are:
{noformat}

CLC (10.111.5.2) and UFS (10.111.1.55) logs attached

Relevant chunk of log on CLC:

fields.summary: Unable to set object storage provider during configuration, NPE in CLC log
fields.environment:
{code}
default_attributes:
  eucalyptus:
    default-img-url: http://images.walrus.cloud.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img
    enterprise-repo: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/enterprise-devel/centos/6/x86_64/
    euca2ools-repo: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/euca2ools-devel/centos/6/x86_64/
    eucalyptus-repo: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/centos/6/x86_64/
    imaging-vm-type: m1.medium
    init-script-url: http://git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/qa-repos/eucalele/raw/master/deploy-helpers/scripts/network-interfaces.sh
    install-service-image: 'true'
    install-type: packages
    log-level: DEBUG
    nc:
      max-cores: 32
    network:
      bridge-interface: br0
      bridged-nic: em1
      config-json:
        Clusters:
        - Name: one
          PrivateIps:
          - 10.111.75.150
          - 10.111.75.151
          - 10.111.75.152
          - 10.111.75.153
          - 10.111.75.154
          - 10.111.75.155
          - 10.111.75.156
          - 10.111.75.157
          Subnet:
            Gateway: 10.111.0.1
            Name: 10.111.0.0
            Netmask: 255.255.0.0
            Subnet: 10.111.0.0
        InstanceDnsServers: &id001
        - 10.111.1.55
        Mode: EDGE
        PublicIps:
        - 10.111.75.134
        - 10.111.75.135
        - 10.111.75.136
        - 10.111.75.137
        - 10.111.75.146
        - 10.111.75.147
        - 10.111.75.148
        - 10.111.75.149
      mode: EDGE
      nc-router: N
      private-interface: br0
      public-interface: br0
    source-branch: master
    source-repo: ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal
    system-properties:
      cloud.euca_log_level: DEBUG
      cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist: '*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com'
    topology:
      clc-1: 10.111.5.2
      clusters:
        one:
          cc-1: 10.111.5.2
          das-device: vg01
          nodes: 10.111.5.65
          sc-1: 10.111.5.2
          storage-backend: das
      user-facing: *id001
      walrus: 10.111.5.2
    yum-options: --nogpg
description: Eucalyptus CI Testing
name: viglesias-3844
{code}

comments.body: Today CI is passing, so either this is timing dependent or it somehow got fixed?
My guess is that this is timing dependent.

Have not seen this repeated in CI or manual testing. Based on log output it looks like there was an issue with the system bootstrap and binding (error binding on port 8773) and that several services failed to bootstrap as a result, not just the OSG. Can reopen if seen again.
NPE resolved in 4.2, but registration is still wonky and [~mbacchi] will file a separate ticket for that.
